title: India advises citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Iran
byline: The Indian Embassy in Iran issued a travel advisory on Wednesday, urging Indian nationals to avoid non-essential travel to Iran.

title: Shooting incident reported in Weligama
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Weligama, police stated.

title: Showers expected in several areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Sabaragamuwa province and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: “Artha” National Programme launched
byline: The official launch of the “Artha” National Programme took place in Colombo yesterday (15).

title: Two killed as New Jersey and New York City battered by heavy rain and flash floods
byline: Two people were killed in New Jersey during flash flooding as severe storms lashed the New York City area on Monday night into Tuesday, submerging cars and flooding subway stations.

title: Tesla enters India with $70,000 Model Y as Musk yields to steep tariffs
byline: Tesla launched on Tuesday its Model Y at about $70,000 in India, a significant markup relative to its other major markets, reflecting the country’s high tariffs on electric vehicle imports which CEO Elon Musk,  has long-criticised.

title: Youth political delegates in India for two-week programme
byline: A 24-member youth delegation of political leaders from Sri Lanka is currently in India for a two-week long programme, according to the Ministry of External Affairs of India.

title: ‘Severance’ leads Emmy nominees with 27 and ‘The Studio’ tops comedies as Apple TV+ dominates
byline: “Severance” separated itself from the field with 27 Emmy nominations Tuesday, while “The Studio” led comedy nominees with a record-tying 23 in a dominant year for Apple TV+.

title: PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla’s return after historic space mission
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday praised Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla for his “dedication, courage and pioneering spirit”, as the astronaut returned to Earth after spending 18 days aboard the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Donald Trump sets 19% tariff on Indonesia goods in latest deal
byline: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the US would impose a 19 percent tariff on goods from Indonesia under a new agreement with the Southeast Asian country.

title: A’pura Hospital sexual assault case: Suspect seeks to make another statement in court
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has rejected a request made by a former army soldier, who is a suspect in a sexual assault case involving a female specialist doctor, seeking permission to make another statement in court.

title: Case on Sarath Fonseka Assassination Attempt: Colombo HC adjourns hearing till August
byline: The Colombo High Court today (July 16) ordered the adjournment of further hearing of the case filed against three defendants accused of attempting to assassinate the then Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, General Sarath Fonseka, in a suicide bombing at the Colombo Army Headquarters in 2006.

title: Four suspects arrested in connection with fatal shooting and abduction in Kahawatta
byline: Four suspects have been arrested in connection with the abduction and the murder of a youth in Kahawatta on June 30.

title: MoU signed between Sri Lanka and Oman to exchange intelligence on money laundering activities
byline: The Financial Intelligence Unit of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the National Center for Financial Information in Oman (NCFI-Oman), during the 31st Plenary of the Egmont Group, held in Luxembourg.

title: Trading at CSE temporarily halted
byline: The Market has been temporarily halted due to broker order management system (OMS) failure being experienced at majority of broker firms.

title: Two killed in separate road accidents
byline: Two individuals have died in separate road accidents reported in Kekirawa and Nochchiyagama yesterday, police stated.

title: Tom Holland says ‘Spider-Man 4’ will be a ‘breath of fresh air’
byline: The much-awaited fourth Spider-Man movie starring Tom Holland seems to be taking shape finally.

title: Cuban minister resigns after saying country has no beggars
byline: Cuban Minister for Labour and Social Security, Marta Elena Feitó-Cabrera, has been forced to resign from her post after she made comments in a parliamentary session which denied the existence of beggars on the Communist-run island.

title: Israel strikes near the defense ministry in Syria
byline: The Israeli army said Wednesday that it struck near the entrance to the Syrian Ministry of Defense in Damascus.

title: Sri Lanka committed to strengthening regional solar cooperation – PM Harini
byline: The second day of the Seventh meeting of the International Solar Allience (ISA) Regional committee for Asia and the Pacific Region was held today (16) focusing on advancing Regional cooperation for a Solar-powered future at Hotel ITC Ratnadipa, Colombo with the participation of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: China donates school uniform fabric worth Rs. 5.17 bln to Sri Lanka for 2025
byline: China will always remain a trusted friend and ally of Sri Lanka, said Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Qi Zhenhong, during a ceremony held at the Ministry of Education in Battaramulla today (16).

title: Suspect arrested with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth over Rs. 30 mn at BIA
byline: A passenger has been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ cannabis estimated to be worth around Rs. 31 million into the country.

title: Thousands of Afghans secretly moved to Britain after data leak
byline: Britain set up a secret scheme to bring thousands of Afghans to the UK after their personal details were disclosed in one of the country’s worst ever data breaches, putting them at risk of reprisals from the Taliban after their return to power.

title: Over 1.3 mln illegal narcotic pills seized by Navy in Kalpitiya; five arrested
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy announced that five individuals have been taken into custody along with three dinghy boats and a large stock of illegal narcotic pills during a maritime operation conducted in the Kalpitiya area.

title: Over 50 LG bodies yet to be formed despite nearly 2 months since polls
byline: Although almost two months have passed since the 2025 Local Government Elections concluded, councils have reportedly not yet been formed under new Mayors or Chairpersons in over 50 local government institutions.

title: CID chief Shani Abeysekara named a witness in Eknaligoda case
byline: The Attorney General’s Department today (16)  informed the Colombo High Court that the incumbent Director of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), Shani Abeysekara, has been named as a witness in the case concerning the alleged abduction and forced disappearance of journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda.

title: Suspect arrested with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth over Rs. 30 million at BIA
byline: A passenger has been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ cannabis estimated to be worth around Rs. 31 million into the country.

title: President urges Sports Ministry and associations to collaborate for international success
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized the need for the Ministry of Sports and Sports Associations to collaborate on joint initiatives aimed at elevating Sri Lankan sports to the international stage.

title: Court allows to detain and question 2 suspects in Kahawatta shooting incident
byline: Police have been granted permission to detain for a period of seven days and question two of the four suspects arrested in connection with the abduction and murder of a youth in Kahawatta.

title: Police Constable arrested over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder released on bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to Hasitha Roshan, a Constable attached to Athurugiriya Police, who was remanded in custody on suspicion of involvement in the murder of notorious drug trafficker and criminal gang leader Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa,” inside the Hulftsdorp Court.

title: Rare Gandhi oil portrait sold for more than $200,000
byline: A rare oil portrait of Indian independence leader Mahatma Gandhi has been sold at auction in London for £152,800 ($204,648).

title: President holds 2026 pre-budget discussions with FinMin officials
byline: A discussion on the preliminary budget framework and development direction related to the submission of proposals for the 2026 Budget was held this afternoon (16) at the Presidential Secretariat between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and officials of the Ministry of Finance.

title: TikTok to support digitalization of education in Sri Lanka
byline: A representative team of TikTok social media platform in Sri Lanka visited the Secretary to the Prime Minister today (16) at the Prime Minister’s Office for discussions focusing on common issues in the possible areas of using digital platforms,..
